provisions.part: Part I – Establishment of National Population Council
provisions.title: Establishment of Council
provisions.content: (1) There is established by this Act a body to be known as the National Population Council referred to in this Act as the “Council”. provisions.part: Part I – Establishment of National Population Council
provisions.title: Functions of the Council
provisions.content: The Council shall have the following functions— advise the Government on population programmes and activities which the Council considers necessary for better and effective population management; advise the Government on population programmes and activities which the Council considers necessary for better and effective population management; recommend such new population policies or changes to existing policies as it considers necessary for a better and effective population management; recommend such new population policies or changes to existing policies as it considers necessary for a better and effective population management; promote comprehensive population programmes for integration into the national development plans; promote comprehensive population programmes for integration into the national development plans; determine targets for population programme performance and the expected impact and recommend strategies for their achievement; determine targets for population programme performance and the expected impact and recommend strategies for their achievement; encourage the full participation of the private sector in attaining the set population targets or goals; encourage the full participation of the private sector in attaining the set population targets or goals; promote research and studies on population issues; promote research and studies on population issues; co-ordinate and monitor population programmes in the country; co-ordinate and monitor population programmes in the country; advise on suitable methods for generating internal and external resources to support the implementation of population policies; and advise on suitable methods for generating internal and external resources to support the implementation of population policies; and perform such other functions as are incidental to the foregoing. perform such other functions as are incidental to the foregoing.

provisions.part: Part I – Establishment of National Population Council
provisions.title: Tenure of office of members
provisions.content: (1) A member of the Council other than the Executive Director shall hold office for a period not exceeding three years and shall on the expiration of that period be eligible for re-appointment. A member of the Council other than the Executive Director shall hold office for a period not exceeding three years and shall on the expiration of that period be eligible for re-appointment. (2) A member of the Council other than the Executive Director may at any time by letter addressed to the President resign his office. (3) A member who is absent from three consecutive meetings of the Council without sufficient cause shall cease to be a member. A member who is absent from three consecutive meetings of the Council without sufficient cause shall cease to be a member. (4) The Chairman or a member of the Council may be removed from office by the President for inability to perform the functions of his office, for stated misbehaviour or for any other just cause. (5) The Chairman of the Council shall notify the President of vacancies that occur in the membership of the Council within three months of occurrence of the vacancy. provisions.part: Part I – Establishment of National Population Council

provisions.content: (1) The Council shall meet for the despatch of business at such times and in such places as the Chairman may determine but shall meet at least twice in a year. provisions.title: Committees of the Council
provisions.content: The Council may for the discharge of its functions appoint committees including technical committees of the Council comprising members of the Council or non-members or both and may assign to any such committee such functions of the Council as it may determine.
